      static float hier_scaffolds_utils.commonScaffoldTanimoto(ScaffoldTree scaftreeA, ScaffoldTree scaftreeB, Scaffold mcScaf)
      Returns similarity metric designed to reflect the significance of the maximum common scaffold between two molecules. Given by the formula:
        sim = nc / (na + nb - nc)
      where
        nc = # atoms in common scaffold
        na = # atoms in max scaffold, mol A
        nb = # atoms in max scaffold, mol B
      This is an experimental functionality. Intended for use in combination with a standard whole-molecule similarity metric. Use this faster method if mcScaf is already calculated (with maxCommonScaffold()).
      boolean ScaffoldSet.containsScaffold(Scaffold scaf)
      True if Scaffold present with same cansmi.
      boolean Scaffold.equals(Scaffold scaf2) 
      Scaffold Scaffold.findChildScaffold(Scaffold scaf)
      Search for child scaffold equal to the specified scaffold; if not found return null.
      static int hscaf_utils.findChildScaffolds(Scaffold scaf, ScaffoldSet scafset, ScaffoldStore scafstore)
      This recursive algorithm finds all child scaffolds. For each junction bond, copy scaffold and cut bond, resulting in two parts which may be valid scaffolds (sidechains have been deleted, but one part may comprise invalid scaffold benzene). Special case is junction bonds to hydrogens, which denote attachment points. Then recurse and find grandchild scaffolds for each child scaffold. For simple 2-way linkers it is redundant to cut both junctions of a linker, but for (3+)-way linkers this allows enumeration of all combinations. For each scaffold found, if unique (via canonical smiles), add new child and specify its parentage. If no junction bonds exist, findChildScaffolds() returns null, recursion terminates, and the current scaffold is a leaf. The heavy-lifting goes through this method. ScaffoldSet and ScaffoldStore store known scaffolds to avoid costly re-analysis. With ScaffoldSet, if scaffold already known, use existing scaffold object, not new child candidate object. With ScaffoldStore, new object must be used.
      Scaffold ScaffoldSet.findScaffold(Scaffold scaf)
      Return Scaffold with same cansmi, if present, otherwise null.
      Long ScaffoldSet.getScaffoldID(Scaffold scaf)
      Returns ID of Scaffold with same cansmi if present, null otherwise.
      int ScaffoldDB.mergeScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Merges a fully populated ScaffoldTree defined by the Scaffold argument with the ScaffoldDB. New scaffolds are assigned new IDs. Existing scaffolds are recognized as such. Initially called with new root scaffold, then recursively. For each call, process all immediate child scaffolds, then assign ChildIDs and ParentID to ScaffoldRecord. Note that a new unknown parent may have known and/or new child scaffolds. Hence this recursive method must handle the known-scaffold case.
      int ScaffoldSet.mergeScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Merges a complete [sub]ScaffoldTree defined by the Scaffold argument with the ScaffoldSet. New scaffolds are assigned new IDs, which is the main purpose of this method. Existing scaffolds are recognized as such, should have IDs, since found during hscaf_utils.findChildScaffolds. Initially called with new root scaffold, then recursively. For each call, process all immediate child scaffolds, then recurse. Child scaffolds present in set are same instances, not only equal. Returns number of new scaffolds merged.
      int ScaffoldStore.mergeScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Merges a fully populated ScaffoldTree defined by the Scaffold argument with the ScaffoldStore. New scaffolds are assigned new IDs. Existing scaffolds are recognized as such. Initially called with new root scaffold, then recursively. For each call, process all immediate child scaffolds, then assign ChildIds and ParentId to ScaffoldEntity. Note that a new unknown parent may have known and/or new child scaffolds. Hence this recursive method must handle the known-scaffold case.
      int ScaffoldDB.populateScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Populates an incomplete ScaffoldTree from known root Scaffold. Note that since root scaffold is known, all child scaffolds must also be known. For known scaffold, obtain ID from store, and find child scaffolds in store to populate ScaffoldTree.
      int ScaffoldStore.populateScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Populates an incomplete ScaffoldTree from known root Scaffold. Note that since root scaffold is known, all child scaffolds must also be known. For known scaffold, obtain ID from store, and find child scaffolds in store to populate ScaffoldTree.
      void Scaffold.setParentScaffold(Scaffold scaf2)
